The Opportunity:

Your role at Sephora... As our Director, IT Operations & Service Management, reporting to Sephora’s Senior Director, Infrastructure Engineering this role provides senior leadership to drive strategic vision for Sephora end user technology support and service management. Develop and execute new initiatives through staff to enable all Sephora employees to do their best work every day. Work collaboratively to define and execute business priorities with other functional and technology areas of Sephora and senior leaders in various global markets. The ideal candidate should be a highly qualified executive with substantial experience designing, managing, and continuously improving IT Operational Support and Service Management teams, policies, and process to ensure the stability of our enterprise technologies while also delivering exceptional service to our clients. S/he will have relevant management experience within a large, complex managed technology services organization and be responsible for all aspects of Service Management partnering with stakeholders and direct reports.


Your responsibilities include:

  • Identify, define, and continuously improve new and existing policies, standards, and framework for IT Operations, Support, and Service Management governance. Implement and maintain a process structure aligned to global standards that meets business needs while balancing compliance with risk and cost
  • Own continual improvement and ongoing process maturity through regular reviews of the business needs, process, tools, trend analysis, metrics reporting, and regular engagement with stakeholders for all aspects of IT Service Management & Technical Support Services

  • Design and build a robust Problem Management practice, ensuring each major incident is analyzed and corrective and preventative activities are identified and followed through while also doing the same for recurrent non-major incidents
  • Define and implement a strategy to drive the adoption and continuously improve compliance with all service management policies, standards, and framework

  • Supervisory duties for IT Operations & Service Management Team Leaders (ITSM, Knowledge Management, Support/Help Desk Services, Desktop Support). Includes Technical Leadership/guidance, assigning and reviewing work regularly, setting and adjusting priorities, and evaluating work performance.
  • Demonstrate our Sephora values: Passion, Innovation, Expertise, Balance, Respect, Teamwork, and Initiative.


We would love to hear from you if…

  • 10+ years of hands-on experience in a Technology role / organization combined with strong management and communication skills
  • 5+ years as a people leader in a Senior Manager (or above) role in IT Operations and Service Management
  • 5+ years directly managing teams responsible for and / or managed services for Service Desk for a Retail organization or equivalent
  • 5+ years designing, managing, and / or continuously core IT Service Management processes (Incident, Problem, Change)
  • Experience using ServiceNow or Atlassian platforms to manage ITSM / Knowledge with strong operational experience
  • Demonstrated ability to implement mature ITSM practices in a fast-growing organization
  • Demonstrated ability to develop strong alliances with those outside of your immediate organization
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including the ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical staff
  • Flexibility in work schedule, off-hours for project implementation, major incidents, and on call rotational support (24x7)

POSITION SUMMARY

Reporting to the VP, Head of IT, CARGO Therapeutics is hiring a Senior Director of IT Applications. This position will be responsible for the overall management and delivery of IT applications needed by all CARGO business functions (Research, Translational Sciences, Clinical Development and Operations, Technical Operations, Pharmacovigilance, Quality, Regulatory, General and Administrative). The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills and robust pharma/biotech IT experience with Cell & Gene therapy exposure. This position will directly interact with the business functions on key use cases and priorities, define robust IT roadmaps, manage expectations, ensure delivery, and manage vendors/partners.

The role is based in San Mateo, CA but may also be suitable for a hybrid work arrangement.

WHAT YOU’LL DO AT CARGO THERAPEUTICS

  • Understand and align with business drivers and priorities.
  • Ability to interact with senior management to map business priorities to IT needs, as well as in various settings such as steering committees, 1:1s, and presentations.
  • Contribute and maintain a robust IT roadmap of applications including definition of project objectives, prioritization, and implementation plans.
  • Establish and foster relationships with Business Stakeholders and Service Providers.
  • Manage multiple vendors including completion of RFPs/RFIs where applicable, negotiating IT contracts, oversight of vendor fulfillment of contractual responsibilities, and monitoring Service Level Agreement performance.
  • Evaluate vendor solutions, develop alternatives, and recommend technical solutions to meet the evolving needs of the business.
  • Manage and be hands-on during execution of projects: scoping, requirements, documentation, testing, validation, training, and support.
  • Play multiple roles in IT to support and enhance current application stack (Sharepoint / Microsoft 365, Veeva, Benchling, etc.).
  • Establish and enforce IT Governance and Change control amongst IT and business teams to prioritize and implement improvements for all enterprise systems.
  • Contribute to creating SOPs, Policies, and Process and System maps for applications.
  • Collaborate closely with Quality to ensure proper validation of applications where applicable (GxP standards).
  • Adopt and champion a pragmatic risk-based approach for validation/CSV.
  • Ensure compliance with various regulatory environments (SOX, GxP, EMA, GDPR, Privacy, HIPAA, etc.).
  • Identify and analyze key technology trends that can be leveraged at CARGO.
  • Embody the collaborative, innovative, and disciplined culture of the CARGO G&A team.

THE RIGHT STUFF: Required Experience & Qualifications

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science preferred) with at least 8+ years of work experience and a minimum of 5 years in the Pharmaceutical/Biotechnology industry. Knowledge and background with a Cell & Gene Therapy company is a big plus.
  • Understanding of both US and Global requirements (EU, APAC) from an IT and Compliance perspective.
  • Experience working in a regulated environment (SOX, GxP, GDPR, HIPAA).
  • Strong background in software development methodology (i.e., Agile, SDLC, ITIL) and project management/business analysis.
  • Proven application expertise relevant to business processes and functions across the value chain in a biotech company (from Research to Commercial).
  • Project management skills and strong focus on delivery.
  • Experience with various applications such as SharePoint, ERP, LIMS, MES, Veeva, LMS, HR, Supply Chain Planning, Reporting/Data mart, and Commercial systems.
  • Ability to navigate from strategic to operational, and hands-on with a sense of urgency and a solutions-oriented filter.
  • Demonstrated effective leadership and management skills in building high performance teams with a focus on teamwork and collaboration.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and excellent presentation and communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate complex problems in a non-technical and simplified manner to stakeholders and end-users and to effectively communicate business needs to technology partners/resources.
  • Self-motivated with a high degree of initiative and excellent follow-up skills, along with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced small company environment with minimal direction and changing priorities.
  • Travel required to HQ site (San Mateo at least once a month) and to potential other locations.

PAY RANGE

The combined pay range for this role is $208,000 - $280,000. Title and salary will be based on our assessment of skills and experience relevant to our needs for the role.

ABOUT CARGO THERAPEUTICS

CARGO Therapeutics is engineering best-in-class CAR T-cell therapy to overcome resistance to cancer treatment and address barriers to access so that more patients may benefit from potentially curative therapies. CARGO is on a mission to outsmart cancer by advancing a new generation of best-in-class chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapies. Despite advances made by commercially available autologous CARs, these treatments are curative for fewer than half of all cancer patients. In addition, far too many patients are unable to access these potentially curative therapies due to other challenges, including manufacturing, supply constraints, slow turnaround time and reimbursement hurdles. The team at CARGO is intensely focused on pursuing novel solutions to achieve better cancer treatment outcomes and experiences.

Our founders are pioneers and world experts in CAR T-cell therapy, and we have built a team with experience and success developing, manufacturing, launching and commercializing oncology and cell therapy products. CARGO Therapeutics colleagues share a passion to help others thrive. We are tenacious in the relentless pursuit of our mission, and we innovate to change the game for the patients we serve.

Join us to help make a difference!

Here's what all the hype is about Premier Nutrition Company, LLC (PNC) is a clear leader in the convenient nutrition category and makes great-tasting food products under the brand names Premier Protein, Dymatize, and PowerBar, and is part of publicly-traded BellRing Brands (NYSE:BRBR). PNC treats its people like adults with respect and trust. One of our five core values is to Connect & Belong because we bring our diverse backgrounds, life experiences, and ways of thinking to each challenge grounded in our belief that everyone should have a seat at the table and be listened to deeply. Whever makes you, you - you belong here.

We strive to avoid many of the outdated processes of conventional workplaces. We don't have performance reviews we have quarterly conversations. We don't have management we have inspiring leaders to coach and mentor. We don't have a casual dress code we simply don't have a dress code; wear what you like. And we have a lot of fun.

Bringing dogs to work, company-wide give-days days, philanthropy and sustainability programs, in-office massages, walking meetings, and free daily exercise classes on-site and at the adjacent gym are just a few ways we make work feel less like work. And the results of our great culture speak for itself: we were certified as a Great Place to Work™ for the seventh year-running in 2023 and ranked in the top 12 on Fortune Magazine’s Best Workplaces in our category for the past four years.

So, what's it like to work here? If you're local, you'll walk into our Emeryville office each Monday morning and find 100 of your colleagues sitting on sofas, beanbag chairs, or the floor excitedly talking through the week ahead and watching one of their colleagues tell their personal life and career journey. Picture a casual and collaborative environment of a start-up, the innovative mindset of a tech company, and the stability of a company with revenue last year of over $1.3 billion, and you'll find us in the sweet spot where world-class culture meets robust business results.

PNC seeks individuals who will thrive in this work environment and will help us build our culture and this high-growth company for the next phase in our amazing journey. Does this sound like you? Then read on.
Responsibilities:

The Role…

Director of Infrastructure is responsible for oversight and operational leadership of all Premier Nutrition IT Infrastructure (Data Center, Network, Cloud Operations, Security, and Workforce Productivity, including Phones & Conferencing) related systems and services. This individual will have the role of directing a team that manages IT service providers, projects, continuous improvement initiatives, and strategic objectives that are related to these IT service domains. This role is also responsible for effective vendor management, maintaining healthy relationships and strong performance levels among the managed service providers under contract with Premier Nutrition. Maintaining strong relationships with business leaders across Premier Nutrition, as it is critical for IT to partner with other departments to understand business requirements and deliver solutions. This individual will also partner with IT leaders across Premier Nutrition to collaborate on and deliver solutions that benefit and safeguard the entire enterprise.

The position will be based out of our 60,000 sq. foot, modern Emeryville, California office. WE ARE A CULTURE OF PERSONAL CONNECTON, WHICH IS WHY WE’VE CHOSEN A PERMANENT HYBRID WORK ENVIRONMENT WITH NORMS THAT EQUATE TO 2-3 DAYS MID-WEEK IN THE OFFICE FOR EMPLOYEES BASED IN NORTHERN CALIFORNIA. The expected pay scale for this role is $200k to $210k, which may vary based on relevant experience, qualifications, geographic area (if applicable), and internal equity for the role.


You’re excited about this opportunity because your time will be filled with…


Strategy, Innovation, and Architecture: 25% of Time

  • Collaborate with CIO to develop and execute the company's IT strategy and assess and recommend infrastructure improvements, upgrades, and IT investments to enhance efficiency, scalability, and performance.
  • Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of the company's IT infrastructure, including networks, servers, storage systems, virtualization, and telecommunications systems.
  • Establishes metrics, key performance indicators and service level agreements for driving the performance of IT service delivery.
  • Work with CIO to strengthen policies and procedures to reduce risk and improve infrastructure reliability.
  • Collaborates with IT leaders across Premier Nutrition to develop and implement infrastructure technology strategies for both enterprise-wide and company-specific programs that will add value to and protect the organization.
  • Develops or approves IT cloud, security, and other applicable architectures along with supporting functional and technical documentation.
  • Researches new technology and develops business cases to support company and enterprise-wide initiatives.
  • Creates, manages, and reviews processes, partnering with business colleagues to establish appropriate service level objectives, and deliver projects and continuous improvement initiatives across all infrastructure-related solutions and services.
  • Ensures that IT projects are delivered on time, under budget, and with quality.
  • Proactively identifies processes that would benefit from system automation to increase operating efficiencies then deliver a design for the solution.
  • Assesses the impact of IT industry trends to current and future enterprise infrastructure needs and projects


Operations and Service Level Management: 25% of Time

  • Oversight of business continuity and disaster recovery of company's information systems, including needs analysis, design, plan, implementation, and documentation.
  • Oversee facilities team to support physical security systems, conference rooms, AV, visitor systems, etc.
  • Oversight of the IT Security team which maintains security measures to protect the company's IT infrastructure, data, and systems from cyber threats and coordinate response to security incidents with key stakeholders as necessary.
  • Oversees and directs the daily operations of IT network, operations, workforce productivity, and core/cloud infrastructure services for PHI.
  • Maintains a continuous improvement approach with staff and managed service providers to optimize system performance and proactively avoid issues.
  • Manages department level budgets in line with internal peer cost benchmarks. Accountable for P&L and Capital project spend under the areas of accountability listed above. Manage a $2M+ budget for SaaS services, equipment, and third party contracted services.
  • Acts as escalation point for complex and urgent Helpdesk issues.
  • Effective and efficient assessment, planning, and mitigation of Premier Nutrition’s infrastructure related risks
  • Change Control - Oversees that appropriate changes from production or test regions are planned into the Premier Nutrition system environments.
  • Works with colleagues and staff to improve infrastructure costs, data center efficiency, performance, and workforce productivity and end-user satisfaction
  • Ensure high availability, reliability, and security of infrastructure components.


Team & Supplier Management: 25% of Time

  • Able to attract, develop, lead and retain high caliber IT talent that accomplishes superior results
  • Manage a team of engineers who provide technical guidance and support to end-users for hardware, software, and network-related issues.
  • Manages goals and performance levels of staff and service providers that partner with Premier Nutrition for infrastructure and network-related IT services.
  • Carries supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
  • Establishes effective resourcing models, leveraging internal and external resources to efficiently and effectively deliver projects, changes, and operational support.
  • Manages the technical accuracy and solution issues from third-party partners who provide SaaS, PaaS, or IaaS systems that exist in our cloud infrastructure ecosystem.
  • Influences internal and external partners to support Premier’s technology vision and operating needs
  • Partners with legal and contract service teams and is proficient at contract negotiation
  • Manage a 3rd party helpdesk and improve customer satisfaction through continuous improvements to first call resolution and self-service initiatives.

  • Attending meetings and presentations
  • Participating in company-wide activities and events galore
  • Impromptu conversations with colleagues
  • Administrivia like email, calendaring, expense reports, and other non-value-added work

  • Detailed understanding of infrastructure design practices, infrastructure operations and standards, and security standards and frameworks.
  • Maintains an understanding of industry and technology trends and how they may impact business operations
  • Impartial approach to reasoning (e.g. prioritization, trade-off analysis, organizational psychology)
  • Executive presence - demonstrates humility and self-awareness in personal interactions
  • Influencing - able to accomplish goals & results and align on plans in a matrix environment
  • Demonstrated experience building a strategy to evaluate, recommend, and implement commercial hardware and software security products to augment and enhance the Company enterprise security program
  • Strong knowledge of networking protocols, systems administration, Office365, and telecommunications systems.
  • Experience in implementing and managing network security, firewalls, intrusion detection systems (IDS), and vulnerability management.
  • Able to present solutions and findings to all levels of the organization including C-level executives to obtain buy-in and approval.
  • Operates independently but in alignment with company and enterprise vision and objectives


Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Security or equivalent work experience

Experience:

  • 15+ years of Infrastructure and Virtualization Support Experience
  • 7+ years of leadership in enterprise environments with 1,000+ users
  • 5+ years' experience with Cloud Strategy, security, risk management, and disaster recovery


Skills:

  • Strong skills with Office365, Azure, the Microsoft Security Stack, and their infrastructure components.
  • Great oral and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills to be able to effectively communicate and negotiate with both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Strong capabilities in disaster recovery planning, backup solutions, and business continuity processes.
  • Excellent analytical and decision-making skills
  • Experience with ServiceNOW or similar IT Service Management System
  • Familiar with ITIL, COBIT, or similar framework for managing IT infrastructure departments.
  • Strong Experience with NIST or similar security framework

Job Description:
About Stellar Health:

Historically, US Healthcare has relied on a fee-for-service reimbursement system where providers are paid based on the quantity of patient visits and procedures, rather than the quality of health outcomes.

At Stellar Health, we help primary care providers put patient health first. Our platform - a mix of technology, people, and analytics - supports providers at the point of care, delivering real-time patient information, activating practice staff, and empowering providers and care teams with incentives that reward the work they are already doing to keep patients healthy. Using the Stellar App, our web-based, point-of-care tool; practices receive a simple checklist of recommended actions that support the best quality care. Providers and care teams are then paid monthly for each action they complete, and Payors save money in reduced healthcare costs along the way.

Stellar is a US-based Health-tech backed by Top VCs (General Atlantic, Point72, & Primary Venture Partners) with an established product & proven operating model. We've shown that we make a real difference for physician practices and their patients.

About the position:

Stellar Health is looking for a Director of Product Management to join us! You will own a piece of the product footprint, shape our Product Management culture, partner with a world class engineering team, and work directly with the senior leadership team. Best of all, you will work directly with end users to impact patient care for millions of Americans.

You will love this job if:

  • You are a stellar communicator. You excel at simplifying complex concepts for varied audiences in both written and verbal form.
  • You are user-focused. You obsess over getting to know our users, understanding their needs and wants, and anticipating opportunities they haven't yet imagined.
  • You are data-driven. You love to perform quantitative and qualitative product analyses, to see trends, to generate and validate hypotheses, and run experiments.
  • You are action-oriented. You get things done and you love working in a dynamic environment.
  • You have an ownership mindset. You understand, appreciate, and enjoy the responsibility and accountability that comes with owning products and their success.
  • You are collaborative. You enjoy and are excellent at partnering with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, operations, growth, and compliance.
  • You are passionate. You bring energy, enthusiasm and optimism to solving important problems for our users and our business.

In this role, you will:

  • Own a vertical of Stellar's product, and be accountable to measurably improving that product for our users and our business.
  • Create and get buy-in for a strategy and roadmap to drive results.
  • For roadmap items, write clear and concise Product Requirements Documents.
  • Partner with engineering and design to bring features and products to life in an excellent and timely manner.
  • Measure and report on the impact of features and products your team has built.
  • Collaborate regularly with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, compliance, and others to accomplish the above.
  • Help establish processes to improve Stellar Health's product development practices.
  • Provide effective and constructive feedback by reviewing others' work.

You should have:

  • 10+ years total experience.
  • At least 5 years of professional work experience in SaaS or web-based application product management.
  • A proven track record of using data to solve business problems.
  • Previous experience working on a product with consumer or small business end users.
  • Experience working on products that support healthcare delivery is an advantage.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially in the form of translating technical concepts to business stakeholders.'

Pay:

At Stellar, we believe in transparency and we do our best to make sure the company and our candidates are on the same page as it relates to compensation. In addition to posting salary ranges for our open roles, candidates should expect to be asked about compensation expectations and requirements early on in their interview process. Our goal is to highlight when expectations and Stellar's salary range may be out of sync, and work with the candidate to determine whether it makes sense to continue conversations.

Where a new hire falls within this range will be based on their individual skills and experience, and how these competencies compare across other employees in the same role. Stellar's bands are designed to allow for individual compensation growth within the role. As such, new hires typically start at the lower end of the range. Stellar rewards performance and outcomes - should you join the company, you will have the opportunity to grow your salary over time.

  • The base salary range for a Director of Product Management is $220,000-$260,000 and will be eligible for equity and an annual performance based bonus.

Perks & Benefits:

Stellar offers a carefully curated selection of wellness benefits and perks to our employees:

  • Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits
  • Unlimited PTO (and ask our recruiting team about the ways we make sure employees are actually taking PTO)
  • Universal Paid Family Leave, with up to 21 weeks of fully paid leave available to new parents and caregivers
  • Company sponsored One Medical memberships and Citibike memberships
  • Medical Travel Benefits
  • A monthly wellness stipend that gives employees the freedom to choose where they spend their cash, whether it be on wellness, pet care, childcare, WFH items, or charitable donations
  • Stock Options & a 401k matching program
  • Career development opportunities like Manager Training, coaching, and an internal mobility program
  • A broad calendar of company sponsored social events that for our in-office and remote employees

Diversity is the key to our success. Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience with system design, algorithms, data structures, analysis, and software design.
  • 15 years of experience managing a distributed team of engineers, and experience growing and building teams.
  • Experience conducting technical in-depth searches into code.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience serving an Enterprise business.
  • Ability to encourage accountability and take responsibility for outcomes, mobilize the organization to deliver excellence, and persevere to get things done.
  • Ability to assess and solve problems, identify root causes, and develop, evaluate, and implement the right solutions by analyzing information/data logically.
  • Ability to be courageous, humble, and transparent while fostering a sense of community and assisting team members.
  • Excellent collaboration, relationship building, and talent import/export skills across organizational boundaries and geographies.

About the job

Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE ensures that Google's services—both our internally critical and our externally-visible systems—have reliability, uptime appropriate to users' needs and a fast rate of improvement. Additionally SRE’s will keep an ever-watchful eye on our systems capacity and performance. Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation.

On the SRE team, you’ll have the opportunity to manage the complex challenges of scale which are unique to Google, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design.

SRE's culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, problem solving and openness is key to its success. Our organization brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We encourage them to collaborate, think big and take risks in a blame-free environment. We promote self-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.

To learn more: check out our books on Site Reliability Engineering or read a career profile about why a Software Engineer chose to join SRE.

As Director, you will contribute to the direction and strategy of the Geo and Commerce Product Areas and foster deeper engagement between Product Area and Google Site Reliability Engineering organization to maximize business impact, ensuring reliable systems for our customers and our end users, and agile infrastructure to enable product change. Each area carries with it incredible challenges and opportunities to delight our users.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.


Responsibilities

  • Maintain a partnership between Dev/SRE, and become a contributing member of both the Geo and Commerce Product Area leadership teams.
  • Drive the strategy for the business as a contributor to overall Google Knowledge and Information strategy.
  • Lead an SRE organization with a mission to ensure that Google’s Geo and Commerce services have reliability and uptime appropriate to users’ needs and a fast rate of improvement while keeping an ever-watchful eye on capacity and performance.
  • Inspire innovation and new thinking to maximize long-term product feature velocity while meeting reliability goals.
  • Respond to client reliability concerns. Lead resource management and efficiency strategy.

An Introduction
You’re an original. So are we.
We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

About the Opportunity
Be a pioneer in the fashion industry by joining our team that is delivering AI-based and digitized capabilities to drive a shorter, smarter, integrated, digitally-enabled go to market (GTM) approach and calendar.
We are looking for a Director of Product & Experience as we pioneer AI-based Digital solutions at LS&Co. We are seeking an experienced Product Leader to lead the vision and delivery of our portfolio of digital planning experiences for the Merchandise Planning & Inventory Management (MPIM) function at LS&Co. You and your team will lead the experiences for capabilities including forecasting, sizing, allocation and inventory management. You will report to the VP of Global Internal Product Management
You and your team will help define and drive the product strategy and roadmap delivery. You will craft product vision, co-develop Objectives & Key Results (OKRs), and define roadmaps with your team to best meet those OKRs. You should be willing to dive deep when needed, move rapidly with a bias for action, and get things done. You should have an entrepreneurial spirit, know how to deliver, and long for the opportunity to build pioneering solutions to challenging problems. You will need to build strong collaboration with the business, and engineering. Your stakeholder management skills will also be critically important.
Details of the Job
  • Help drive the digital transformation for the MPIM function, with a clear product strategy across your portfolio
  • Define product vision for each of your products
  • Motivate and inspire your team and stakeholders to champion the product vision, goals, strategy, and benefits
  • Partner with business teams to deeply understand individualized needs, and be the voice of our users to deliver the best solution against those needs
  • Partner with engineering and delivery teams to ensure that concepts/features are delivered that drive our OKRs
  • Partner with leaders to increase adoption of new ways of working

About You
  • Bachelor’s degree: MBA preferred
  • 8+ years of experience in a Product Management role

  • You have an entrepreneurial spirit, love autonomy & working in a fast-paced environment, know how to deliver, and long for the opportunity to design pioneering solutions to challenging problems.
  • Experience with agile product management where a culture of experimentation and continuous delivery and discovery is promoted
  • You have an understanding and passion for product and design methodologies with a strong focus on human-centered design

  • Experience leading and working across data, technical and business teams in a matrixed organization
  • Understanding of technology concepts and effects, ability to manage trade-offs and evaluate new opportunities with all partners
